meanings.definition: In a direct line of descent from an ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The lineal connection between the siblings was evident in their shared traits.
meanings.sent2: The lineal descendants of the king inherited the throne.
meanings.sent3: The lineal relationship between the two families made for an interesting family tree.
meanings.sent4: The lineal bond between the coach and the team was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The lineal link between the past and the present was strong.

meanings.definition: In a straight line or direction.
meanings.sent1: She walked lineally towards the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The arrow flew lineally through the air.
meanings.sent3: The car moved lineally down the road, never deviating from its path.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed lineally towards the sea.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved lineally across the stage with grace.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a line.
meanings.sent1: The lineal pattern on the fabric was simple yet elegant.
meanings.sent2: The lineal design of the building gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The lineal arrangement of the books on the shelf made them easy to find.
meanings.sent4: The lineal markings on the map helped navigate the route.
meanings.sent5: The lineal shape of the object made it easy to stack.
